definitions.definition: a unit of weight in general use equal to 16 oz. avoirdupois (0.4536 kg).
a unit of weight equal to 12 oz. troy (0.3732 kg) used for precious metals.
the basic monetary unit of the UK, equal to 100 pence.
the basic monetary unit of several Middle Eastern countries, equal to 100 piastres.
the former basic monetary unit of Cyprus, equal to 100 cents.
strike or hit heavily and repeatedly.
examples: Patrick pounded the couch with his fists
synonyms: beat the living daylights out of
whale "the two men pounded him with their fists"beat against
fire on; archaiccannonade "gunships pounded the capital"

definitions.definition: crush or grind (something) into a powder or paste by beating it with an instrument such as a pestle.
examples: pound the cloves with salt and pepper until smooth
synonyms: pulp; technicaltriturate "pound the cloves with salt"

definitions.definition: beat, throb, or vibrate with a strong regular rhythm.
walk or run with heavy steps.
examples: I heard him pounding along the gangway
synonyms: trudge "I heard him pounding along the gangway"

definitions.definition: defeat (an opponent) in a resounding way.
examples: the Yankees pounded the Red Sox 22â€“1

definitions.definition: a place where stray animals, especially dogs, may be officially taken and kept until claimed by their owners or otherwise disposed of.
examples: enclosure, compound, pen, yard, corral a dog pound

definitions.definition: a place where illegally parked motor vehicles removed by the police are kept until their owners pay a fine in order to reclaim them.
a place of confinement; a trap or prison.
